item.title: 美国司法部正在考虑是否允许维基解密创始人朱利安-阿桑奇（Julian Assange）对不当处理机密信息的指控认罪，从而为长达 14 年的法律诉讼画上句号。
item.description:
The Justice Department is considering whether to allow WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to plead guilty to a reduced charge of mishandling classified information, opening the possibility of an end to a 14-year legal saga https://t.co/LsPjCjmejl https://t.co/LsPjCjmejl

item.title: 在普莱西德湖（Lake Placid），一位前奥运雪橇运动员正在以 2,850 万美元的价格挂牌出售其占地约 15,000 平方英尺的住宅。如果售价接近其要价，该房产将创下该地区最昂贵房屋的销售记录。
item.description:
In Lake Placid, a former Olympic luger is listing his roughly 15,000-square-foot home for $28.5 million. The estate will set a record for the priciest home ever sold in the area if it fetches close to its asking price. https://t.co/1wRf1iKEDX https://t.co/1wRf1iKEDX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/yMd6IDwBwq https://t.co/yMd6IDwBwq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 许多 Z 世代意外地找到了生活在数百或数千英里之外的浪漫伴侣。这个不太可能的媒人就是 Discord 平台。

item.title: 2021 年，亚利桑那州启动了一项计划，旨在扩大那些请不起或找不到律师的人获得法律服务的机会。三年后，该计划吸引了华尔街的目光。
item.description:
In 2021, Arizona launched a program to expand access to legal services for people who can’t afford or find lawyers. Three years later, the program is catching Wall Street’s eye. https://t.co/Z9Zh0kmNSt https://t.co/Z9Zh0kmNSt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 现在可以通过皮肤活检来诊断帕金森病，这种活检可以检测出帕金森病患者神经内的一种异常蛋白质。"皮肤检测基本上就是大脑的一扇窗"。
item.description:
Parkinson’s disease can now be diagnosed with a skin biopsy that can detect an abnormal protein people with Parkinson’s have inside their nerves.

“The skin test basically is a window into the brain." https://t.co/4Cf3TZwfVO https://t.co/4Cf3TZwfVO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在一架中国客机坠毁并导致机上 132 人全部遇难两年后，当局表示仍在调查造成中国最致命空难之一的原因。
item.description:
Two years after a Chinese passenger jet dived into the ground and killed all 132 people aboard, authorities said they are still probing what caused one of China’s deadliest plane crashes https://t.co/s1Vhmjc7eW https://t.co/s1Vhmjc7eW

item.title: 约一年前，《华尔街日报》记者埃文-格什科维奇（Evan Gershkovich）在俄罗斯采访期间被拘留。#我们为那些想支持他的人提供资源。
item.description:
🧵Nearly a year ago, Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was detained in Russia during a reporting trip.

He remains in a Moscow prison.

We’re offering resources for those who want to show their support for him. #IStandWithEvan https://t.co/ll83UMXlp5 pic.twitter.com/iAmDq2BOvj

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024
